Package popt4jlib.MSSC

Package implements algorithms for Minimum-Sum-of-Square(-Errors)-Clustering, a well-defined optimization problem.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ClustererIntf The interface every class implementing algorithms for MSSC clustering should obey.
ClustererTerminationIntf Interface defines the methods that must be supported by any class that will specify termination criteria for a clusterer algorithm.
EvaluatorIntf interface for MSSC evaluations.
 

Class Summary
ClustererTerminationNoCenterMove specifies that a clustering process must stop when two successive calls of isDone() the centers found by the associated clusterer have not moved at all.
ClustererTerminationNoMove specifies that the clustering process may end when in two successive calls of the isDone() method, no vector has changed its assignment to another cluster.
ClustererTerminationNumIters specifies that the clustering process will stop after a fixed number of calls to the isDone() method.
DetAnnealClusterer the class implements the Deterministic Annealing algorithm for MSSC by Rose.
GMeansMTClusterer class implements multi-threaded version of the (hard) K-Means algorithm, in a thread-safe manner.
KMeansPP implements the KMeans++ method for seeds initialization for the K-Means algorithm.
KMeansSqrEvaluator implements the classical MSSC criterion for a given clustering.
NeuralGasMTClusterer parallel implementation of Neural Gas by Martinetz & Schulten for MSSC.
 

Exception Summary
ClustererException Defines a checked exception that may be thrown from clustering algorithms.
 

Package popt4jlib.MSSC Description

Package implements algorithms for Minimum-Sum-of-Square(-Errors)-Clustering, a well-defined optimization problem.

Package Specification

The ClustererIntf interface declares the methods that every MSSC clusterer should implement. The class GMeansMTClusterer is a thread-safe multi-threaded algorithm implementing the (hard-version) K-Means algorithm for MSSC clustering, without the possibility of multiple restarts. The K-Means++ method for seed initialization is also implemented.
